intro: Cymbopetalum gracile, commonly known as the slender cymbopetalum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture.
